name: Deposit Payment
description: This is a facility that allows you to pay the required deposit when entering a payment plan as agreed with Wonderland Gallery. For details on aquiring a payment plan for our products please email us at sales@wonderlandgallery.com

name: GOLF (The Captain's Edition - Limited Edition Luxury Golf Bible)
description: The ‘Captain's Edition’ (Limited to just 2,100 worldwide) is a collectors' dream. Measuring 28cm by 33cm this luxurious leather bound folio publication is held in the personal collections of Palmer, Nicklaus, Jacklin etc. It comprises of 18 chapters, expressed through 584 pieces of uniquely self-contained and editorialized fine art pieces.

name: GOLF. The Tom Morris 1821 Edition
description:
GOLF. The Tom Morris 1821 Edition
Elite Numbers Collectors Edition

The Captain’s Edition is a must have for every collector’s library.
There are also special one off numbered cased editions, aligned to key dates
in golf history. Each unique edition comes in a gold blocked archive case, containing the numbered edition of Golf and a unique print.

You have the opportunity to own the Tom Morris Captain’s Edition of GOLF,
numbered 1821 (his birth year) including a unique, signed one of a kind Tom Morris print for only $2,000 / £1,200 / €1,500
(plus packaging and shipping)

Visit our site www.wonderlandpublications.com for a full list of SPECIAL numbered editions.

name: PLAYGOLF   ( Limited Edition Fine Art 'GOLF' Print designed and published by Won
description:
wg/golf/0156

Limited Edition Print {140}  {UNFRAMED}
Art/Design by Paul  Skellett 
Editorial by Simon Weitzman

315gsm archive paper 
Signed and numbered
by the artist / author

Limited edition 'GOLF' artworks are owned by Colin Montgomerie, Tony Jacklin, Jack Nicklaus, David Leadbetter and Frank Christian, as well as the PGA, Augusta Masters, and St Andrews Links Trust. 

Every clubhouse and home needs fine art on its walls. 

Taken directly from The Tournament Champions Folio Trophy, of which there are only ten in the world, each print celebrates the spirit and heritage of the game, as well as classic course scenes from around the world. Each one is signed and numbered by the authors of GOLF and is printed in Great Britain, on archive museum grade papers. 

Ideal for clubhouses, living rooms, hotel lobbies, receptions, libraries, studies and VIP rooms. 

Approximate delivery time of prints two working weeks from order. Overseas add an additional working week.  

© Wonderland Publications / Bad Halo Limited 2010

name: Deconstructing Marilyn
description:
Limited Edition Print 
Signed and numbered Archival Giclee Print
(Unframed)

Edition of 150

Please Specify the signed print number you would like to request(ex: 41/100, which is print #41 of 100)  If the requested number is not available you will be allocated the next lowest number.

ABOUT THE ORIGINAL
The original is a mixed media painting
using oils, inks, fire, aerosols and gold leaf.
It is painted on board and framed with a deconstructed frame to give the idea of it pulling Marilyn apart.
Every artist in popular art does the Marilyn thing. I was set the challenge of creating a 'pop' painting of Marilyn, I decided to create  in a way that was unique and had depth. It maintains her beauty, but also expresses had she was 'torn'. Paul Skellett

name: Golf Etiquette  ( Limited Edition Fine Art 'GOLF' Print by Wonderland )
description:
wg/golf/0173

Limited Edition Print {140}  {UNFRAMED}
Taken from the Wonderland Publication 'GOLF'
Art/Design by Paul  Skellett 
Editorial by Simon Weitzman

315gsm archive paper 
Signed and numbered
by the artist / author

Limited edition 'GOLF' artworks are owned by Colin Montgomerie, Tony Jacklin, Jack Nicklaus, David Leadbetter and Frank Christian, as well as the PGA, Augusta Masters, and St Andrews Links Trust. 

Every clubhouse and home needs fine art on its walls. 

Taken directly from The Tournament Champions Folio Trophy, of which there are only ten in the world, each print celebrates the spirit and heritage of the game, as well as classic course scenes from around the world. Each one is signed and numbered by the authors of GOLF and is printed in Great Britain, on archive museum grade papers. 

Ideal for clubhouses, living rooms, hotel lobbies, receptions, libraries, studies and VIP rooms. 

Approximate delivery time of prints two working weeks from order. Overseas add an additional working week.  

© Wonderland Publications / Bad Halo Limited 2010

name: The queen of lost dreams by Paul Skellett
description:
Limited Edition Print 
Signed and numbered Archival Giclee Print
(Unframed)

Edition of 150

Please Specify the signed print number you would like to request(ex: 41/100, which is print #41 of 100)  If the requested number is not available you will be allocated the next lowest number.

ABOUT THE ORIGINAL
The original is a mixed media painting
using oils, inks, fire, aerosols and gold leaf.
It is painted on board and framed with a deconstructed frame to give the idea of it pulling Marilyn apart.
Every artist in popular art does the Marilyn thing. I was set the challenge of creating a 'pop' painting of Marilyn, I decided to create  in a way that was unique and had depth. It maintains her beauty, but also expresses had she was 'torn'. Paul Skellett
